Examples of Peripherals

The GPU or the video card is one component most associated with gamers. It is an optional expansion to the computer used most commonly to run video games. Some CPUs have integrated graphics that allow them to be used like a GPU with limitations.
The CPU is the core of any computer as it handles instructions and executes them while interacting with both hardware and software.
The motherboard is where all the components live on top of. Every part of the computer will connect to it someway and will coordinate with them.
The memory or RAM is the short term memory of the computer. It allows the computer to do tasks at higher speeds and can be as small as 8 GBs to 128 GBs.
The storage is the component that holds all your personal data and anything else the computer stores long term.
The power supply is what powers the entire system.
The CPU cooler makes sure the CPU is running at a safe cool temperature.
The case houses the computer’s components.
An operating system is a necessary piece of software that allows you to interface with a computer.
The monitor allows you to view what is happening on your computer.
The peripherals are the accessories that you can plug into the computer. They add functionality to a computer.
Newer GPUs usually come with a variety of ports for monitors like HDMI or display ports or even DVI or VGA ports.
The two choices you will have are AMD and Intel.More cores and a higher clock speed (GHz or MHz) will help your system run better.
Ram is a short term storage different from the storage discussed here. Storage usually comes down to either HDD(Hard Drive Disk) or SSD(Solid State Drive).

The board has many ports and sockets for each part to attach to. The CPU socket needs attention because it will decide the type of CPU you can get. The ports exposed to the outside will be for the many accessories like keyboards, mice, and more
The power supply comes with plugs for all components to maintain their power. It has a power switch accessible from the outside to turn it on or off.

The options for cooling are heat sinks with fan or liquid cooling. The first uses a dab of thermal paste to cool the CPU. Liquid cooling is more complicated and expensive to safely use liquid to cool components more efficiently.

Full Tower is the large case. Mid Tower is the medium size of the case. Micro-ATX is the small. Mini-ITX is the smallest size. Check with each part to make sure that they are compatible with whichever you choose.

Windows is the most widely used operating system and will work with most software.MacOS is only available for Apple laptops and will have specific software that is able to run on it. It is possible to run on other machines, but it will take some work.Linux is a free and open source operating system. It’s not very beginner friendly, but it is the most customizable operating system with many branches of it with specific uses in mind.

Size is just how big the screen is.Resolution is the number of pixels on the monitor which can affect the image quality. Refresh rate matters mostly to only gamers because it involves fast movements and how often the screen refreshes with new information.

Mouse and keyboard are the most common and help to navigate a computer.Speakers are also common since most monitors do not come with speakers built in. Printers are the last example and help export documents to the real world.

Storage is a very important component of the PC just like everything else in the PC. The storage component is a piece of hardware that has the capability to hold information within a certain time frame or forever.In other words, it is a place to store your data either temporarily or permanently.

Arduino is an open source platform which is designed to be easy to use. The Arduino boards can read inputs and turn them into outputs making it a good microcontroller. The Arduino requires a separate computer in order to use the Arduino software, but that software is available on all three major operating systems. The Arduino language is designed to be accessible and the board itself is cheap making it a beginner friendly way to experiment with electronic projects.

A raspberry pi is a low price, credit card sized computer that can do most of anything that a full sized computer can do. Once a keyboard, mouse, and screen are plugged in then it can be used like a regular computer. It’s small size allows it to be used in projects that require a brain to direct commands. It can connect to the internet and can be used to teach many things such as how to program in Python to building smart mirrors.

The CPU (central processing unit) is often called the brain of the system because it handles instructions from both hardware and software. The CPU lives on on the motherboard in the CPU socket covered by a heat sink. The CPU at its most basic performs calculations from instructions it’s sent from peripheral devices or inner hardware like the RAM. Today you will see many options for CPUs from different manufacturers with different line ups of product. Each CPU has its own amount of cores and architectures that differentiates it from other manufacturers or even from older generations of the same product. From experience, do not cheap out on this part of the computer because no expensive GPU or amount of RAM will stop the bottleneck that will occur because of an older low core CPU.

The motherboard acts as the foundation for all other computer parts to live on. It serves to route power to help coordinate how the components work together. It is not the same as the CPU since it does not make computations. The motherboard does more organization of the computation and results. It does not affect performance, but the sockets available will since an older CPU socket will only support older CPUs and more sockets for more RAM would increase the performance of the computer. The motherboard is also home to the BIOS(Basic Input/Output System) which allows you to view hardware information, change your boot drive, manage power settings, and overclock and underclock the CPU or RAM.

The memory or more commonly known as RAM (random access memory) is a short term memory location for the computer. Without RAM the computer would take much longer to open applications or do tasks. It is able to retrieve and store data the computer needs now or soon at high speeds. Unlike the actual storage of the computer, it only stores data when the computer is powered. The high speeds allow the CPU to do more computations without having to dig through a slower regular storage drive. RAM is usually bought in quantities of gigabytes(GB) in increments of 8 GBs in single stick or multiple all the way up to 128 GBs of RAM.

Storage is a very important component of the PC just like everything else in the PC. The storage component is a piece of hardware that has the capability to hold information within a certain time frame or forever. In other words, it is a place to store your data either temporarily or permanently.
Gives power to all the components in the PC.

The CPU cooler job to make sure the CPU has the proper cooling it needs. By keeping the CPU cool, the computer is able to run more efficiently. The CPU could reach unsafe temperatures which could damage it. There are two main ways to cool a CPU.

The case houses all the computer’s components. It protects everything inside and influences the airflow in the case. There are four main types when choosing a computer case. When choosing the right case it’s important to check the components that may have trouble fitting in the case. The motherboard, the length of the GPU, air CPU cooler height, and liquid cooling radiator size are some common compatibility issues. The last two factors when choosing the right case is the aesthetics and the cooling possibilities it provides. The aesthetics are composed of the outside like color, but also the kind of cable management options it offers. The cooling possibilities are important since more areas for fans or better airflow will make for cooler components that will last you longer.

An operating system is installed on the computer’s hard drive which allows the user to operate other software. It manages all peripherals connected as well as the hardware connected. There are a lot of operating systems and branches of them, but here will discuss the main three options for desktop computers.

The monitor is the display of the system. It will display any and everything you want to do with the computer. It is important to figure out what you will be using the system for to then decide which size, resolution, and refresh rate.

The peripherals are the many accessories that one can plug into a computer. It will add functionality and need a computer to function. They commonly connect using USB, but may use different ports or more than one.

Depending on the GPU you purchase and when you purchased it the ports on the GPU may differ a little, but not by too much. For example, if you were to purchase a GPU back in 2003 the ports that would be included with it would consist of the DVI port, a VGA port and a S-Video port. If you were to purchase the up and coming GPU in the market you would find yourself having many HDMI ports, some DisplayPorts and depending on the GPU manufacturer you could find yourself having a DVI or even a VGA port.

The main two companies producing CPUs are AMD and Intel. The core count can go from two all the way up to sixty-four for professional settings. Clock speed is another piece of information that is advertised a lot when shopping for CPUs. Clock speed is measured in megahertz(MHz) or gigahertz (GHz) and means how many instructions a CPU can handle per second. The speed of the computer will depend on multiple factors other than the clock speed like the other components.

When you store information for a short amount of time the PC will normally store it in the RAM(Memory), if you would like to learn more about the Memory component please click on the Memory page. The second place in which information is stored is the HDD(Hard Drive Disk) or SSD(Solid State Drive). These components are the

The back panel of the motherboard holds many of the ports needed to attach peripherals to interact with the computer. Most newer boards contain a HDMI or Displayport for the monitor, usb ports for mouse and keyboard or any more accessories, and many I/O connectors.

Connection for the power cord to the computer, the fan that pulls out the heat from the internal of the PSU, a switch to change the voltage provided and a rocker switch to turn the power supply on and off.

The typical method of cooling is a heat sink or heat sink with a fan. The cooler is placed with a pea sized drop of thermal paste to help cool it. The heat is moved away from the CPU and the fan can push it out. Additional case fans can help with the general air flow in the computer. This cooling type is typically inexpensive and even is included with some CPUs. Another method of cooling is liquid cooling. It is a more advanced, more expensive type of cooling that generally makes the CPU cooler than it would be with the heat sink combo. It is not recommended for CPUs that are not prone to overheating because the first heating type would be enough. Liquid cooling is more quiet than the fan method with the potential to cool other parts of the system like the GPU. Overall, the system will end up quieter, but any potential mistake may be expensive.

Full Tower is the large case. Mid Tower is the medium size of the case. Micro-ATX is the small. Mini-ITX is the smallest size. Overall all these cases need to be checked against the motherboard the customer is picking since different cases have different dimensions. Finding the right motherboard for your case should not be difficult with the case spec sheet listing what motherboard sizes it will be compatible with. This is also true for the other three parts listed above where it is important to check specs of the component and the case to see if they will fit the case.

Windows is the most common operating system with many versions with the latest being Windows 11 recently. Windows being the most popular also comes with many types of viruses and malware targeting it, but with smart internet uses users do not need to worry. It is favored among gamers because most if not all games made for PC will run on windows.This goes for many other pieces of software because it’s popularity, most companies will make sure it is able to run on windows first. MacOS is another popular operating system used on Apple laptops and desktops. Outside of the Apple ecosystem of products it is less commonly seen because it requires more knowledge and work to get a working “Hackintosh”. MacOS was made for only Apple products so building a computer and trying to use this operating system will take work. If you get an Apple product or “Hackintosh” then you will notice a smaller selection of software options. An Apple laptop is also limited in upgradeability a lot of work which will void warranties. Being less popular means that less viruses are made for it which makes it safer. Many games can be played on MacOS, but the options will be limited and may vary in run quality because of the dependence on the laptop specs.Linux is a free and open source operating system. The open source allows many distributions to be available with specialized functions such as servers. It also allows users to escape the corporate operating systems to a more open source environment. It can be customized to one’s desire.The amount of customizability can be intimidating leaving users unfamiliar with command line confused. Gaming will be very limited on it and same for software. If learned, one could take advantage of its full potential.

Size is just the screen size. It is labeled in inches and it is listed as the diagonal length when purchasing a monitor. Which you pick will depend on how big of a screen you like.Resolution is the number of pixels that make up a screen. The more pixels means the higher resolution which makes for a sharper image. The more common resolution you will see is Full HD (FHD) which is 1920x1080, but it can go as high as 5k which is 5120 x 2880. It is important to make sure your system can handle a 4k monitor before purchasing one.Refresh rate is a feature that only really matters to gamers. It is measured in hertz(Hz) and is the number of times the monitor updates with new information per second. The high refresh rate then the less choppy an image. It can matter for high paced gameplay, but for office or home use then any monitor should work fine.

Mouse helps in controlling the computer by clicking where a user decides they want to go.Keyboard is also important because it allows for more interactions on a computer. Typing allows users to search and make documents.Speakers are often an accessory because most monitors do not come with built in speakers. It allows the users to listen to music and video over their system.Printer is the last common peripheral you will find. It allows you to print out documents and any other pages one chooses.
